conflicts.description: boost: Errors with out-of-date API calls from MPI
boost: Errors with out-of-date API calls from Python

dependencies.description:
bzip2 is a freely available, patent free high-quality data compressor.
It typically compresses files to within 10% to 15% of the best available
techniques (the PPM family of statistical compressors), whilst being
around twice as fast at compression and six times faster at
decompression.
dependencies.name: bzip2

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: cxx

dependencies.description:
ICU is a mature, widely used set of C/C++ and Java libraries providing
Unicode and Globalization support for software applications. ICU4C is
the C/C++ interface.
dependencies.name: icu4c

dependencies.description: IBM MPI implementation from Spectrum MPI.
dependencies.name: mpi

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.
dependencies.name: xz

dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.
dependencies.name: zlib-api

dependencies.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.
dependencies.name: zstd

dependent_to.description:
The 3D Toolkit provides algorithms and methods to process 3D point
clouds. It includes automatic high-accurate registration (6D
simultaneous localization and mapping, 6D SLAM) and other tools, e.g., a
fast 3D viewer, plane extraction software, etc. Several file formats for
the point clouds are natively supported, new formats can be implemented
easily.
dependent_to.name: 3dtk

dependent_to.description:
ABySS is a de novo, parallel, paired-end sequence assembler that is
designed for short reads. The single-processor version is useful for
assembling genomes up to 100 Mbases in size.
dependent_to.name: abyss

dependent_to.description:
A Common Tracking Software (Acts) This project contains an experiment-
independent set of track reconstruction tools. The main philosophy is to
provide high-level track reconstruction modules that can be used for any
tracking detector. The description of the tracking detector's geometry
is optimized for efficient navigation and quick extrapolation of tracks.
Converters for several common geometry description languages exist.
Having a highly performant, yet largely customizable implementation of
track reconstruction algorithms was a primary objective for the design
of this toolset. Additionally, the applicability to real-life HEP
experiments plays major role in the development process. Apart from
algorithmic code, this project also provides an event data model for the
description of track parameters and measurements. Key features of this
project include: tracking geometry description which can be constructed
from TGeo, DD4Hep, or GDML input, simple and efficient event data model,
performant and highly flexible algorithms for track propagation and
fitting, basic seed finding algorithms.
dependent_to.name: acts

dependent_to.description: An SVG based C++17 plotting library for ACTS detectors and surfaces.
dependent_to.name: actsvg

dependent_to.description: Utility libraries for LLNL performance tools.
dependent_to.name: adept-utils

dependent_to.description:
A package for the automatic differentiation of first and higher
derivatives of vector functions in C and C++ programs by operator
overloading.
dependent_to.name: adol-c

dependent_to.description:
AGILe is A Generator Interface Library (& executable), i.e. a uniform
object oriented C++ interface for a variety of Fortran-based Monte Carlo
event generators..
dependent_to.name: agile

dependent_to.description:
Akantu means a little element in Kinyarwanda, a Bantu language. From
now on it is also an opensource object-oriented Finite Element library
which has the ambition to be generic and efficient.
dependent_to.name: akantu

dependent_to.description:
Alembic is an open computer graphics interchange framework. Alembic
distills complex, animated scenes into a non-procedural, application-
independent set of baked geometric results.
dependent_to.name: alembic

dependent_to.description: Abstraction Library for Parallel Kernel Acceleration.
dependent_to.name: alpaka

dependent_to.description:
The ALPS project (Algorithms and Libraries for Physics Simulations)
aims at providing generic parallel algorithms for classical and quantum
lattice models and provides utility classes and algorithm for many
others.
dependent_to.name: alps

dependent_to.description:
AmberTools is a free, useful standalone package and a prerequisite for
installing Amber itself. The AmberTools suite is free of charge, and its
components are mostly released under the GNU General Public License
(GPL). A few components are included that are in the public domain or
which have other, open-source, licenses. The libsander and libpbsa
libraries use the LGPL license.
dependent_to.name: ambertools

dependent_to.description:
The Advanced Multi-Physics (AMP) package. The Advanced Multi-Physics
(AMP) package is an open source parallel object-oriented computational
framework that is designed with single and multi-domain multi-physics
applications in mind.
dependent_to.name: amp

dependent_to.description:
AOCL-Sparse is a library that contains basic linear algebra subroutines
for sparse matrices and vectors optimized for AMD EPYC family of
processors. It is designed to be used with C and C++. Current
functionality of sparse library supports SPMV function with CSR and
ELLPACK formats. LICENSING INFORMATION: By downloading, installing and
using this software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the AMD
AOCL-Sparse license agreement. You may obtain a copy of this license
agreement from https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/sparse/eula/sparse-
libraries-4-2-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/sparse/eula/sparse-libraries-
eula.html
dependent_to.name: aocl-sparse

dependent_to.description: RFI detector and quality analysis for astronomical radio observations.
dependent_to.name: aoflagger

dependent_to.description:
ArrayFire is a high performance software library for parallel computing
with an easy-to-use API. Its array based function set makes parallel
programming more accessible.
dependent_to.name: arrayfire

dependent_to.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the C++ bindings.
dependent_to.name: arrow

dependent_to.description: C++ library for network and low-level I/O programming.
dependent_to.name: asio

dependent_to.description:
Aspcud: Package dependency solver Aspcud is a solver for package
dependencies. A package universe and a request to install, remove, or
upgrade packages have to be encoded in the CUDF format. Such a CUDF
document can then be passed to aspcud along with an optimization
criteria to obtain a solution to the given package problem.
dependent_to.name: aspcud

dependent_to.description:
AUGUSTUS is a program that predicts genes in eukaryotic genomic
sequences
dependent_to.name: augustus

dependent_to.description: AutoDock Vina is an open-source program for doing molecular docking
dependent_to.name: autodock-vina

dependent_to.description:
AutomaDeD (Automata-based Debugging for Dissimilar parallel tasks) is a
tool for automatic diagnosis of performance and correctness problems in
MPI applications. It creates control-flow models of each MPI process
and, when a failure occurs, these models are leveraged to find the
origin of problems automatically. MPI calls are intercepted (using
wrappers) to create the models. When an MPI application hangs, AutomaDeD
creates a progress-dependence graph that helps finding the process (or
group of processes) that caused the hang.
dependent_to.name: automaded

dependent_to.description:
The bcl2fastq2 Conversion Software converts base call (BCL) files from a
sequencing run into FASTQ files.
dependent_to.name: bcl2fastq2

dependent_to.description:
BioBloom Tools (BBT) provides the means to create filters for a given
reference and then to categorize sequences.
dependent_to.name: biobloom

dependent_to.description:
Blaze is an open-source, high-performance C++ math library for dense and
sparse arithmetic. With its state-of-the-art Smart Expression Template
implementation Blaze combines the elegance and ease of use of a domain-
specific language with HPC-grade performance, making it one of the most
intuitive and fastest C++ math libraries available.
dependent_to.name: blaze

dependent_to.description: Library for automatic acceleration of array operations
dependent_to.name: bohrium

dependent_to.description:
Branson's purpose is to study different algorithms for parallel Monte
Carlo transport. Currently it contains particle passing and mesh passing
methods for domain decomposition.
dependent_to.name: branson

dependent_to.description: Bridger : An Efficient De novo Transcriptome Assembler For RNA-Seq Data
dependent_to.name: bridger

dependent_to.description:
Caffe is a deep learning framework made with expression, speed, and
modularity in mind. It is developed by the Berkeley Vision and Learning
Center (BVLC) and by community contributors.
dependent_to.name: caffe

dependent_to.description:
Cantera is a suite of object-oriented software tools for problems
involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and/or transport processes.
dependent_to.name: cantera

dependent_to.description: A single molecule sequence assembler for genomes large and small.
dependent_to.name: canu

dependent_to.description: A suite of c++ libraries for radio astronomy data processing.
dependent_to.name: casacore

dependent_to.description:
CASPER (Context-Aware Scheme for Paired-End Read) is state-of-the art
merging tool in terms of accuracy and robustness. Using this
sophisticated merging method, we could get elongated reads from the
forward and reverse reads.
dependent_to.name: casper

dependent_to.description:
CBTF project contains the base code for CBTF that supports creating
components, component networks and the support to connect these
components and component networks into sequential and distributed
network tools.
dependent_to.name: cbtf

dependent_to.description:
CBTF Argo Navis project contains the CUDA collector and supporting
libraries that was done as a result of a DOE SBIR grant.
dependent_to.name: cbtf-argonavis

dependent_to.description:
CBTF Argo Navis GUI project contains the GUI that views OpenSpeedShop
performance information by loading in the Sqlite database files.
dependent_to.name: cbtf-argonavis-gui

dependent_to.description:
CBTF Krell project contains collector and runtime contributions to the
CBTF project. These contributions include many performance data
collectors and support libraries as well as some example tools that
drive the data collection at HPC levels of scale.
dependent_to.name: cbtf-krell

dependent_to.description:
CDT is a C++ library for generating constraint or conforming Delaunay
triangulations.
dependent_to.name: cdt

dependent_to.description:
The Computational Geometry Algorithms Library (CGAL) is a C++ library
that aims to provide easy access to efficient and reliable algorithms in
computational geometry. CGAL is used in various areas needing geometric
computation, such as geographic information systems, computer aided
design, molecular biology, medical imaging, computer graphics, and
robotics.
dependent_to.name: cgal

dependent_to.description:
Channelflow is a software system for numerical analysis of the
incompressible fluid flow in channel geometries, written in C++.
dependent_to.name: channelflow

dependent_to.description:
CleverLeaf is a hydrodynamics mini-app that extends CloverLeaf with
Adaptive Mesh Refinement using the SAMRAI toolkit from Lawrence
Livermore National Laboratory. The primary goal of CleverLeaf is to
evaluate the application of AMR to the Lagrangian-Eulerian hydrodynamics
scheme used by CloverLeaf.
dependent_to.name: cleverleaf

dependent_to.description: a software library containing FFT functions written in OpenCL
dependent_to.name: clfft

dependent_to.description:
The Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit is a unified deep-learning toolkit that
describes neural networks as a series of computational steps via a
directed graph.
dependent_to.name: cntk

dependent_to.description:
Coin is an OpenGL-based, 3D graphics library that has its roots in the
Open Inventor 2.1 API, which Coin still is compatible with.
dependent_to.name: coin3d

dependent_to.description:
COOL provides specific software components and tools for the handling of
the time variation and versioning of the experiment conditions data.
dependent_to.name: cool

dependent_to.description: Schrödinger, Inc's 2D coordinate generation
dependent_to.name: coordgen

dependent_to.description:
CORAL is an abstraction layer with an SQL-free API to access data stored
using relational database technologies. It is used directly by
experiment-specific applications and internally by COOL.
dependent_to.name: coral

dependent_to.description:
The C++ REST SDK is a Microsoft project for cloud-based client-server
communication in native code using a modern asynchronous C++ API design.
This project aims to help C++ developers connect to and interact with
services.
dependent_to.name: cpprestsdk

dependent_to.description:
CRMC (Cosmic Ray Monte Carlo package). CRMC is a package providing a
common interface to access the output from event generators used to
model the secondary particle production in hadronic collisons.
dependent_to.name: crmc

dependent_to.description:
Crow is a C++ microframework for creating HTTP and WebSocket services.
It uses routing similar to Python's Flask, which makes it easy to use.
It is also extremely fast, beating many other C++ and non-C++ web
frameworks.
dependent_to.name: crow

dependent_to.description:
The Dakota toolkit provides a flexible, extensible interface between
analysis codes and iterative systems analysis methods. Dakota contains
algorithms for: - optimization with gradient and non gradient-based
methods; - uncertainty quantification with sampling, reliability,
stochastic - expansion, and epistemic methods; - parameter estimation
with nonlinear least squares methods; - sensitivity/variance analysis
with design of experiments and - parameter study methods. These
capabilities may be used on their own or as components within advanced
strategies such as hybrid optimization, surrogate-based optimization,
mixed integer nonlinear programming, or optimization under uncertainty.
dependent_to.name: dakota

dependent_to.description:
Damaris is a middleware for I/O and in situ analytics targeting large-
scale, MPI-based HPC simulations.
dependent_to.name: damaris

dependent_to.description:
The Distributed Asynchronous Object Storage (DAOS) is an open-source
software-defined object store designed from the ground up for massively
distributed Non Volatile Memory (NVM).
dependent_to.name: daos

dependent_to.description:
DataTransferKit is an open-source software library of parallel solution
transfer services for multiphysics simulations
dependent_to.name: datatransferkit

dependent_to.description:
DBoW2 is an improved version of the DBow library, an open source C++
library for indexing and converting images into a bag-of-word
representation.
dependent_to.name: dbow2

dependent_to.description:
DD4hep is a software framework for providing a complete solution for
full detector description (geometry, materials, visualization, readout,
alignment, calibration, etc.) for the full experiment life cycle
(detector concept development, detector optimization, construction,
operation). It offers a consistent description through a single source
of detector information for simulation, reconstruction, analysis, etc.
It distributed under the LGPLv3 License.
dependent_to.name: dd4hep

dependent_to.description:
C++ software library providing well-documented tools to build finite
element codes for a broad variety of PDEs.
dependent_to.name: dealii

dependent_to.description:
Delly2 is an integrated structural variant prediction method that can
discover, genotype and visualize deletions, tandem duplications,
inversions and translocations at single-nucleotide resolution in short-
read massively parallel sequencing data..
dependent_to.name: delly2

dependent_to.description:
DeNovoGear is a software package to detect de novo mutations using next-
generation sequencing data. It supports the analysis of many
differential experimental designs and uses advanced statistical models
to reduce the false positve rate.
dependent_to.name: denovogear

dependent_to.description: Acts fork of dfelibs, a header-only utility library for C++.
dependent_to.name: dfelibs

dependent_to.description: High-abstracted network simulator for message-passing programs.
dependent_to.name: dimemas

dependent_to.description:
This project contains DisCoTec, a code for the distributed sparse grid
combination technique with MPI parallelization.
dependent_to.name: discotec

dependent_to.description: 'mkdssp' utility. (dictionary of protein secondary structure)
dependent_to.name: dssp

dependent_to.description:
API for dynamic binary instrumentation. Modify programs while they are
executing without recompiling, re-linking, or re-executing.
dependent_to.name: dyninst

dependent_to.description: Dysco is a compressing storage manager for Casacore mearement sets.
dependent_to.name: dysco

dependent_to.description:
ecFlow is a work flow package that enables users to run a large number
of programs (with dependencies on each other and on time) in a
controlled environment. It provides tolerance for hardware and software
failures, combined with good restart capabilities.
dependent_to.name: ecflow

dependent_to.description: A library for numerical weather prediction and climate modelling.
dependent_to.name: ecmwf-atlas

dependent_to.description:
Eigen is a C++ template library for linear algebra matrices, vectors,
numerical solvers, and related algorithms.
dependent_to.name: eigen

dependent_to.description: Elbencho storage benchmark
dependent_to.name: elbencho

dependent_to.description: The Extended Randomized Numerical alignEr using BWT
dependent_to.name: erne

dependent_to.description:
ESyS-Particle is Open Source software for particle-based numerical
modelling. The software implements the Discrete Element Method (DEM), a
widely used technique for modelling processes involving large
deformations, granular flow and/or fragmentation.
dependent_to.name: esys-particle

dependent_to.description: The ethminer is an Ethereum GPU mining worker.
dependent_to.name: ethminer

dependent_to.description:
exempi is a port of Adobe XMP SDK to work on UNIX and to be build with
GNU automake. It includes XMPCore and XMPFiles, libexempi, a C-based API
and exempi a command line tool.
dependent_to.name: exempi

dependent_to.description:
eXpress is a streaming tool for quantifying the abundances of a set of
target sequences from sampled subsequences.
dependent_to.name: express

dependent_to.description:
Extrae is the package devoted to generate tracefiles which can be
analyzed later by Paraver. Extrae is a tool that uses different
interposition mechanisms to inject probes into the target application so
as to gather information regarding the application performance. The
Extrae instrumentation package can instrument the MPI programin model,
and the following parallel programming models either alone or in
conjunction with MPI : OpenMP, CUDA, OpenCL, pthread, OmpSs
dependent_to.name: extrae

dependent_to.description: Lightweight and fast C++ Logging Library
dependent_to.name: fairlogger

dependent_to.description:
C++ Message Queuing Library and Framework
(https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1689985)
dependent_to.name: fairmq

dependent_to.description: Flexible, Asynchronous, Object Data-Exchange Libraries
dependent_to.name: faodel

dependent_to.description:
FEniCS is organized as a collection of interoperable components that
together form the FEniCS Project. These components include the problem-
solving environment DOLFIN, the form compiler FFC, the finite element
tabulator FIAT, the just-in-time compiler Instant / Dijitso, the code
generation interface UFC, the form language UFL and a range of
additional components.
dependent_to.name: fenics

dependent_to.description: Next generation FEniCS problem solving environment
dependent_to.name: fenics-dolfinx

dependent_to.description:
FLANN is a library for performing fast approximate nearest neighbor
searches in high dimensional spaces. It contains a collection of
algorithms we found to work best for nearest neighbor search and a
system for automatically choosing the best algorithm and optimum
parameters depending on the dataset. FLANN is written in C++ and
contains bindings for the following languages: C, MATLAB and Python.
dependent_to.name: flann

dependent_to.description:
FleCSI is a compile-time configurable framework designed to support
multi-physics application development. As such, FleCSI attempts to
provide a very general set of infrastructure design patterns that can be
specialized and extended to suit the needs of a broad variety of solver
and data requirements. Current support includes multi-dimensional mesh
topology, mesh geometry, and mesh adjacency information.
dependent_to.name: flecsi

dependent_to.description:
FleCSPH is a multi-physics compact application that exercises FleCSI
parallel data structures for tree-based particle methods. In particular,
FleCSPH implements a smoothed-particle hydrodynamics (SPH) solver for
the solution of Lagrangian problems in astrophysics and cosmology.
FleCSPH includes support for gravitational forces using the fast
multipole method (FMM).
dependent_to.name: flecsph

dependent_to.description: A scheduler for flux-core
dependent_to.name: flux-sched

dependent_to.description:
Folly (acronymed loosely after Facebook Open Source Library) is a
library of C++11 components designed with practicality and efficiency in
mind. Folly contains a variety of core library components used
extensively at Facebook. In particular, it's often a dependency of
Facebook's other open source C++ efforts and place where those projects
can share code.
dependent_to.name: folly

dependent_to.description:
FoundationDB is a distributed database designed to handle large volumes
of structured data across clusters of commodity servers. It organizes
data as an ordered key-value store and employs ACID transactions for all
operations.
dependent_to.name: foundationdb

dependent_to.description:
FreeCAD is an open-source parametric 3D modeler made primarily to design
real-life objects of any size. Parametric modeling allows you to easily
modify your design by going back into your model history to change its
parameters.
dependent_to.name: freecad

dependent_to.description:
(Function Comparator) is a C++ tool for quickly profiling the
performance of various different abstracted implementations of
mathematical function evaluations
dependent_to.name: func

dependent_to.description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework
dependent_to.name: gaudi

dependent_to.description:
GCTA (Genome-wide Complex Trait Analysis) was originally designed to
estimate the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by all genome-
wide SNPs for complex traits (the GREML method), and has subsequently
extended for many other analyses to better understand the genetic
architecture of complex traits. GCTA currently supports the following
analyses.
dependent_to.name: gcta

dependent_to.description:
Geant4 is a toolkit for the simulation of the passage of particles
through matter. Its areas of application include high energy, nuclear
and accelerator physics, as well as studies in medical and space
science.
dependent_to.name: geant4

dependent_to.description: Benchmark Suite for Heterogenuous FFT Implementations
dependent_to.name: gearshifft

dependent_to.description:
GenGeo is a library of tools for creating complex particle geometries
for use in ESyS-Particle simulations. GenGeo is a standalone application
with a Python API that creates geometry files suitable for importing
into ESyS-Particle simulations. The functionality of GenGeo far exceeds
the in-simulation geometry creation utilities provided by ESyS-Particle
itself.
dependent_to.name: gengeo

dependent_to.description:
gnina (pronounced NEE-na) is a molecular docking program with integrated
support for scoring and optimizing ligands using convolutional neural
networks.
dependent_to.name: gnina

dependent_to.description:
GNU Radio is a free & open-source software development toolkit that
provides signal processing blocks to implement software radios. It can
be used with readily-available, low-cost external RF hardware to create
software-defined radios, or without hardware in a simulation-like
environment. It is widely used in hobbyist, academic, and commercial
environments to support both wireless communications research and real-
world radio systems.
dependent_to.name: gnuradio

dependent_to.description: Software version control visualization.
dependent_to.name: gource

dependent_to.description:
GPI-Space is a task-based workflow management system for parallel
applications. It allows the developers to build domain-specific
workflows using their own parallelization patterns, data management
policies and I/O routines, while relying on the runtime system for the
workflow management. The GPI-Space ecosystem "auto-manages" the
application with dynamic scheduling, built-in distributed memory
transfers and distributed tasks execution.
dependent_to.name: gpi-space

dependent_to.description:
GPlates is desktop software for the interactive visualisation of plate
tectonics. GPlates offers a novel combination of interactive plate
tectonic reconstructions, geographic information system (GIS)
functionality and raster data visualisation. GPlates enables both the
visualisation and the manipulation of plate tectonic reconstructions and
associated data through geological time.
dependent_to.name: gplates

dependent_to.description: High-Performance Linear Algebra-based Graph Primitives on GPUs
dependent_to.name: graphblast

dependent_to.description: High-Performance Graph Primitives on GPUs
dependent_to.name: gunrock

dependent_to.description:
Heaptrack is a heap memory profiler that traces all memory allocations
and annotates these events with stack traces.
dependent_to.name: heaptrack

dependent_to.description:
HELICS is a general-purpose, modular, highly-scalable co-simulation
framework that runs cross-platform (Linux, Windows, and Mac OS X) and
supports both event driven and time series simulation.
dependent_to.name: helics

dependent_to.description: Cooperative multitasking for in situ processing.
dependent_to.name: henson

dependent_to.description:
Hermes Shared Memory contains a variety of data structures and
synchronization primitives which are compatible with shared memory.
dependent_to.name: hermes-shm

dependent_to.description: Herwig is a multi-purpose particle physics event generator.
dependent_to.name: herwig3

dependent_to.description:
Herwig is a multi-purpose particle physics event generator. This package
provides old Herwig++ 2 generator
dependent_to.name: herwigpp

dependent_to.description: heyoka is a C++ library for integration of ODEs via Taylor’s method
dependent_to.name: heyoka

dependent_to.description:
HiCOPS is a software framework for accelerating database peptide search
workflows on supercomputers. HiCOPS provided algorithm-independent
parallelizations and optimizations can be extended into new HPC database
search algorithms or scalably accelerate the existing ones.
dependent_to.name: hicops

dependent_to.description: HighFive - Header only C++ HDF5 interface
dependent_to.name: highfive

dependent_to.description: hipBLAS is a BLAS marshalling library, with multiple supported backends
dependent_to.name: hipblas

dependent_to.description:
hipSYCL is an implementation of the SYCL standard programming model over
NVIDIA CUDA/AMD HIP
dependent_to.name: hipsycl

dependent_to.description:
HISEA is an efficient all-vs-all long read aligner for SMRT sequencing
data. Its algorithm is designed to produce highest alignment sensitivity
among others.
dependent_to.name: hisea

dependent_to.description:
HPCToolkit is an integrated suite of tools for measurement and analysis
of program performance on computers ranging from multicore desktop
systems to the nation's largest supercomputers. By using statistical
sampling of timers and hardware performance counters, HPCToolkit
collects accurate measurements of a program's work, resource
consumption, and inefficiency and attributes them to the full calling
context in which they occur.
dependent_to.name: hpctoolkit

dependent_to.description: C++ runtime system for parallel and distributed applications.
dependent_to.name: hpx

dependent_to.description:
The source code for building the mkhssp and hsspconv programs is bundled
in the hssp project. The mkhssp executable creates stockholm files with
hssp annotations in them. The hsspconv executable converts stockholm to
the original hssp format.
dependent_to.name: hssp

dependent_to.description:
Hybrid-Lambda is a software package that can simulate gene trees within
a rooted species network or a rooted species tree under the coalescent
process. The main feature of this program is that users can choose to
use the standard Kingman coalescent process, which produces bifurcating
genealogies, or two other Lambda coalescent processes, which produce
multifurcating genealogies. The other feature is that hybrid sim uses
extended Newick formatted strings to make it easier to represent
hybridization events between species.
dependent_to.name: hybrid-lambda

dependent_to.description: High-performance regular expression matching library.
dependent_to.name: hyperscan

dependent_to.description: Misc. reusable utilities used by IceBin.
dependent_to.name: ibmisc

dependent_to.description:
Image Domain Gridding (IDG) is a fast method for convolutional
resampling (gridding/degridding) of radio astronomical data
(visibilities). Direction-dependent effects (DDEs) or A-tems can be
applied in the gridding process.
dependent_to.name: idg

dependent_to.description:
Jali is a parallel, unstructured mesh infrastructure library designed
for use by multi-physics simulations.
dependent_to.name: jali

dependent_to.description:
KADATH SPECTRAL SOLVER. The Frankfurt University/Kadath (FUKA) Initial
Data solver branch is a collection of ID solvers aimed at delivering
consistent initial data (ID) solutions to the eXtended Conformal Thin-
Sandwich (XCTS) formulation of Einstein's field equations for a variety
of compact object configurations to include extremely compact,
asymmetric, and mixed spin binaries.
dependent_to.name: kadath

dependent_to.description:
KiCad is an open source software suite for Electronic Design Automation
(EDA). The programs handle Schematic Capture, and PCB Layout with Gerber
output.

dependent_to.description:
Software infrastructure that enables HPC run-time tools to co-locate
tool daemons with a parallel job.
dependent_to.name: launchmon

dependent_to.description:
Built based on the Apache Arrow columnar memory format, cuDF is a GPU
DataFrame library for loading, joining, aggregating, filtering, and
otherwise manipulating data.
dependent_to.name: libcudf

dependent_to.description: libfive is a software library and set of tools for solid modeling.
dependent_to.name: libfive

Libint is a high-performance library for computing Gaussian integrals in
quantum mechanics.

dependent_to.description:
libLAS is a C/C++ library for reading and writing the very common LAS
LiDAR format.

dependent_to.description:
The libMesh library provides a framework for the numerical simulation of
partial differential equations using arbitrary unstructured
discretizations on serial and parallel platforms.
dependent_to.name: libmesh

dependent_to.description:
libmolgrid is a library to generate tensors from molecular data, with
properties that make its output particularly suited to machine learning.
dependent_to.name: libmolgrid

dependent_to.description: A generic abstraction for the compression of dense tensors
dependent_to.name: libpressio

dependent_to.description: General Utilities for LibPressio
dependent_to.name: libpressio-tools

dependent_to.description:
libpulsar is a C/C++ client library implementation of the Apache Pulsar
protocol.
dependent_to.name: libpulsar

dependent_to.description:
The ristra library is a set of support utilities for ristra codes,
including simple mathematical operations, physical units, and input
parsing
dependent_to.name: libristra

dependent_to.description: libROM: library for computing large-scale reduced order models
dependent_to.name: librom

dependent_to.description: A compatibility header for C++14, 17, and 20 for C++11
dependent_to.name: libstdcompat

dependent_to.description: A C++ port of Log4j
dependent_to.name: log4cxx

dependent_to.description:
LoRDEC is a program to correct sequencing errors in long reads from 3rd
generation sequencing with high error rate, and is especially intended
for PacBio reads.
dependent_to.name: lordec

dependent_to.description: Lightweight Trained Neural Network.
dependent_to.name: lwtnn

dependent_to.description: Parser for Schrodinger Maestro files
dependent_to.name: maeparser

dependent_to.description:
Magics is the latest generation of the ECMWF's Meteorological plotting
software MAGICS. Although completely redesigned in C++, it is intended
to be as backwards-compatible as possible with the Fortran interface.
dependent_to.name: magics

dependent_to.description:
mallocMC: Memory Allocator for Many Core Architectures. This project
provides a framework for fast memory managers on many core accelerators.
Currently, it supports NVIDIA GPUs of compute capability sm_20 or higher
through the ScatterAlloc algorithm. mallocMC is header-only, but
requires a few other C++ libraries to be available.
dependent_to.name: mallocmc

dependent_to.description:
mapnik combines pixel-perfect image output with lightning-fast
cartographic algorithms, and exposes interfaces in C++, Python, and Node
dependent_to.name: mapnik

dependent_to.description:
MariaDB Server is one of the most popular database servers in the world.
MariaDB turns data into structured information in a wide array of
applications, ranging from banking to websites. It is an enhanced, drop-
in replacement for MySQL. MariaDB is used because it is fast, scalable
and robust, with a rich ecosystem of storage engines, plugins and many
other tools make it very versatile for a wide variety of use cases.
dependent_to.name: mariadb

dependent_to.description:
MaSuRCA is whole genome assembly software. It combines the efficiency of
the de Bruijn graph and Overlap-Layout-Consensus (OLC) approaches.
dependent_to.name: masurca

dependent_to.description:
Meraculous is a while genome assembler for Next Generation Sequencing
data geared for large genomes.
dependent_to.name: meraculous

dependent_to.description: Mercury is a C library for implementing RPC, optimized for HPC
dependent_to.name: mercury

dependent_to.description:
MetaBAT, an efficient tool for accurately reconstructing single genomes
from complex microbial communities.
dependent_to.name: metabat

dependent_to.description:
METACARPA is designed for meta-analysing genetic association studies
with overlapping or related samples, when details of the overlap or
relatedness are unknown. It implements and expands a method first
described by Province and Borecki.
dependent_to.name: metacarpa

dependent_to.description: A Persistent Memory Allocator For Data-Centric Analytics
dependent_to.name: metall

dependent_to.description:
The MFrontGenericInterfaceSupport project (MGIS) provides helper
functions for various solvers to interact with behaviour written using
MFront generic interface. MGIS is written in C++. Bindings are provided
for C and fortran (2003). A FEniCS binding is also available.
dependent_to.name: mgis

dependent_to.description: AMD's library for high performance machine learning primitives.
dependent_to.name: miopen-hip

dependent_to.description: AMD's library for high performance machine learning primitives.
dependent_to.name: miopen-opencl

dependent_to.description:
MIRA is a multi-pass DNA sequence data assembler/mapper for whole genome
and EST/RNASeq projects.
dependent_to.name: mira

dependent_to.description:
C++ utility collection. Provides various facilities of common use in
modern codebases like dynamic linking helpers, loadable plugins
facilities and misc patterns.
dependent_to.name: modern-wheel

dependent_to.description: An implementation of the statistical approach to machine translation
dependent_to.name: mosesdecoder

dependent_to.description:
This project seeks to develop a single piece of open-source, expandable
software to fill the bioinformatics needs of the microbial ecology
community.
dependent_to.name: mothur

dependent_to.description: mp++ is a C++11/14/17/20 library for multiprecision arithmetic
dependent_to.name: mppp

dependent_to.description: The MRNet Multi-Cast Reduction Network.
dependent_to.name: mrnet

dependent_to.description: A small, fast binary interchange format convertible to/from JSON
dependent_to.name: msgpack-c

dependent_to.description:
Multiverso is a parameter server based framework for training machine
learning models on big data with numbers of machines.
dependent_to.name: multiverso

dependent_to.description:
The Muster library provides implementations of sequential and parallel
K-Medoids clustering algorithms. It is intended as a general framework
for parallel cluster analysis, particularly for performance data
analysis on systems with very large numbers of processes.
dependent_to.name: muster

dependent_to.description: MySQL is an open source relational database management system.
dependent_to.name: mysql

dependent_to.description:
N2p2 (The neural network potential package) provides ready-to-use
software for high-dimensional neural network potentials in computational
physics and chemistry.
dependent_to.name: n2p2

dependent_to.description: Nalu-Wind: Wind energy focused variant of Nalu.
dependent_to.name: nalu-wind

dependent_to.description: RMBlast search engine for NCBI
dependent_to.name: ncbi-rmblastn

dependent_to.description: NCBI C++ Toolkit
dependent_to.name: ncbi-toolkit

A High-Throughput Parallel Lossless Compressor for Scientific Data
forked from: https://github.com/fknorr/ndzip
dependent_to.name: ndzip

dependent_to.description: Nektar++: Spectral/hp Element Framework
dependent_to.name: nektar

dependent_to.description:
NEURON is a simulation environment for single and networks of neurons.
NEURON is a simulation environment for modeling individual and networks
of neurons. NEURON models individual neurons via the use of sections
that are automatically subdivided into individual compartments, instead
of requiring the user to manually create compartments.
dependent_to.name: neuron

dependent_to.description: Nix, the purely functional package manager
dependent_to.name: nix

dependent_to.description: ns-3 is a discrete-event network simulator
dependent_to.name: ns-3-dev

dependent_to.description: nvbandwidth: A tool for bandwidth measurements on NVIDIA GPUs.
dependent_to.name: nvbandwidth

dependent_to.description:
Open Microscopy Environment OME Files is a standalone C++ library for
reading and writing life sciences image file formats. It is the
reference implementation of the OME-TIFF file format.
dependent_to.name: ome-files-cpp

dependent_to.description:
OmpSs-2 is a data-flow shared-memory programming model based on source
annotations. It is developed by the Barcelona Supercomputing Center as a
successor to the StarSs and OmpSs programming models.
dependent_to.name: ompss-2

dependent_to.description:
Open Babel is a chemical toolbox designed to speak the many languages of
chemical data. It's an open, collaborative project allowing anyone to
search, convert, analyze, or store data from molecular modeling,
chemistry, solid-state materials, biochemistry, or related areas.
dependent_to.name: openbabel

dependent_to.description: Open Data Detector for High Energy Physics.
dependent_to.name: opendatadetector

dependent_to.description:
OpenFOAM is a GPL-opensource C++ CFD-toolbox. This offering is supported
by OpenCFD Ltd, producer and distributor of the OpenFOAM software via
www.openfoam.com, and owner of the OPENFOAM trademark. OpenCFD Ltd has
been developing and releasing OpenFOAM since its debut in 2004.
dependent_to.name: openfoam

dependent_to.description:
Reading, writing, and processing images in a wide variety of file
formats, using a format-agnostic API, aimed at VFX applications.
dependent_to.name: openimageio

dependent_to.description:
OpenSpeedShop is a community effort led by Trenza, Inc. It builds on top
of a broad list of community infrastructures, most notably Dyninst and
MRNet from UW, libmonitor from Rice, and PAPI from UTK. OpenSpeedShop is
an open source multi platform Linux performance tool which is targeted
to support performance analysis of applications running on both single
node and large scale IA64, IA32, EM64T, AMD64, PPC, ARM, Power8, Intel
Phi, Blue Gene and Cray platforms. OpenSpeedShop development is hosted
by Trenza Inc.. The infrastructure and base components of OpenSpeedShop
are released as open source code primarily under LGPL.
dependent_to.name: openspeedshop

dependent_to.description:
OpenSpeedShop is a community effort led by Trenza, Inc. It builds on top
of a broad list of community infrastructures, most notably Dyninst and
MRNet from UW, libmonitor from Rice, and PAPI from UTK. OpenSpeedShop is
an open source multi platform Linux performance tool which is targeted
to support performance analysis of applications running on both single
node and large scale IA64, IA32, EM64T, AMD64, PPC, ARM, Power8, Intel
Phi, Blue Gene and Cray platforms. OpenSpeedShop development is hosted
by Trenza Inc.. The infrastructure and base components of OpenSpeedShop
are released as open source code primarily under LGPL. openspeedshop-
utils is a package that does not have the qt3 gui. It was created to
avoid a conflict between openspeedshop and cbtf-argonavis-gui based on
the fact that spack will not allow a qt3 and qt4/qt5 dependency in a
packages dependency tree.
dependent_to.name: openspeedshop-utils

dependent_to.description:
OpenTURNS is a scientific C++ and Python library featuring an internal
data model and algorithms dedicated to the treatment of uncertainties.
The main goal of this library is to provide all functionalities needed
to treat uncertainties in studies with industrial applications. Targeted
users are all engineers who want to introduce the probabilistic
dimension in their so far deterministic studies.
dependent_to.name: openturns

dependent_to.description: OpenVDB - a sparse volume data format.
dependent_to.name: openvdb

dependent_to.description: In-memory IO server of the Ophidia framework
dependent_to.name: ophidia-io-server

dependent_to.description: Array-based primitives for the Ophidia framework
dependent_to.name: ophidia-primitives

dependent_to.description:
Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer (and its Python alter ego
PyGMO) is a C++ / Python platform to perform parallel computations of
optimisation tasks (global and local) via the asynchronous generalized
island model.
dependent_to.name: pagmo

dependent_to.description:
Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer (and its Python alter ego
PyGMO) is a C++ / Python platform to perform parallel computations of
optimisation tasks (global and local) via the asynchronous generalized
island model.
dependent_to.name: pagmo2

dependent_to.description:
PajeNG is a re-implementation of the well-known Paje visualization tool
for the analysis of execution traces. PajeNG comprises the libpaje
library, and an auxiliary tool called pj_dump to transform Paje trace
files to Comma-Separated Value (CSV). The space-time visualization tool
called pajeng had been deprecated (removed from the sources) since
modern tools do a better job (see pj_gantt).
dependent_to.name: pajeng

dependent_to.description:
A C++ white-box object-oriented framework dedicated to the reusable
design of metaheuristics.
dependent_to.name: paradiseo

dependent_to.description:
"A very powerful performance visualization and analysis tool based on
traces that can be used to analyse any information that is expressed on
its input trace format. Traces for parallel MPI, OpenMP and other
programs can be genereated with Extrae. Note: This package is deprecated
in favor of wxparaver
dependent_to.name: paraver

dependent_to.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application. This package includes the Catalyst in-situ
library for versions 5.7 and greater, otherwise use the catalyst
package.
dependent_to.name: paraview

dependent_to.description: C++ bindings for the Apache Parquet columnar data format.
dependent_to.name: parquet-cpp

dependent_to.description: ParSplice code implements the Parallel Trajectory Splicing algorithm
dependent_to.name: parsplice

dependent_to.description:
The pbbam software package provides components to create, query, & edit
PacBio BAM files and associated indices. These components include a core
C++ library, bindings for additional languages, and command-line
utilities.
dependent_to.name: pbbam

dependent_to.description:
The Point Cloud Library (PCL) is a standalone, large scale, open project
for 2D/3D image and point cloud processing.
dependent_to.name: pcl

dependent_to.description:
Parallel mesh refinement and adaptivity tools for the finite element
method.
dependent_to.name: percept

dependent_to.description:
Percona Server is a branch of MySQL 8.0 bringing higher performance,
reliability and more features.
dependent_to.name: percona-server

dependent_to.description: C++ runtime system for parallellism and concurrency.
dependent_to.name: pika

dependent_to.description: C++ parallel algorithms built on pika.
dependent_to.name: pika-algorithms

dependent_to.description:
Piranha is a computer-algebra library for the symbolic manipulation of
sparse multivariate polynomials and other closely-related symbolic
objects (such as Poisson series).
dependent_to.name: piranha

dependent_to.description: Processing Kernel for geospatial data
dependent_to.name: pktools

dependent_to.description: polymake is open source software for research in polyhedral geometry
dependent_to.name: polymake

dependent_to.description: A poorman's JIT library
dependent_to.name: poorjit

dependent_to.description: Poppler is a PDF rendering library based on the xpdf-3.0 code base.
dependent_to.name: poppler

dependent_to.description: PORTable CULLing of Invalid Splice junctions
dependent_to.name: portcullis

dependent_to.description:
The Persistence of Vision Raytracer creates three-dimensional, photo-
realistic images using a rendering technique called ray-tracing. It
reads in a text file containing information describing the objects and
lighting in a scene and generates an image of that scene from the view
point of a camera also described in the text file. Ray-tracing is not a
fast process by any means, but it produces very high quality images with
realistic reflections, shading, perspective and other effects.
dependent_to.name: povray

dependent_to.description:
preCICE (Precise Code Interaction Coupling Environment) is a coupling
library for partitioned multi-physics simulations. Partitioned means
that preCICE couples existing programs (solvers) capable of simulating a
subpart of the complete physics involved in a simulation.
dependent_to.name: precice

dependent_to.description:
Psi4 is an open-source suite of ab initio quantum chemistry programs
designed for efficient, high-accuracy simulations of a variety of
molecular properties.
dependent_to.name: psi4

dependent_to.description:
PURIFY is an open-source collection of routines written in C++ available
under the license below. It implements different tools and high-level to
perform radio interferometric imaging, i.e. to recover images from the
Fourier measurements taken by radio interferometric telescopes.
dependent_to.name: purify

dependent_to.description: Advanced Multilanguage Interface for CVODES and IDAS
dependent_to.name: py-amici

dependent_to.description: Spatial indexer for geometries and morphologies
dependent_to.name: py-brain-indexer

dependent_to.description:
ESPResSo is a highly versatile software package for performing and
analyzing scientific Molecular Dynamics many-particle simulations of
coarse-grained atomistic or bead-spring models as they are used in soft
matter research in physics, chemistry and molecular biology. It can be
used to simulate systems such as polymers, liquid crystals, colloids,
polyelectrolytes, ferrofluids and biological systems, for example DNA
and lipid membranes. It also has a DPD and lattice Boltzmann solver for
hydrodynamic interactions, and allows several particle couplings to the
LB fluid.
dependent_to.name: py-espresso

dependent_to.description:
ESPResSo++ is an extensible, flexible, fast and parallel simulation
software for soft matter research. It is a highly versatile software
package for the scientific simulation and analysis of coarse-grained
atomistic or bead-spring models as they are used in soft matter research
dependent_to.name: py-espressopp

dependent_to.description: Python2 and 3 bindings for gfal2.
dependent_to.name: py-gfal2-python

dependent_to.description:
The PyIlmBase libraries provides python bindings for the IlmBase
libraries.
dependent_to.name: py-ilmbase

dependent_to.description:
PyCUDA gives you easy, Pythonic access to Nvidia's CUDA parallel
computation API
dependent_to.name: py-pycuda

dependent_to.description: Python bindings for mapnik
dependent_to.name: py-python-mapnik

dependent_to.description: Quality Assessment Tool for Genome Assemblies
dependent_to.name: py-quast

dependent_to.description:
Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer (and its Python alter ego
PyGMO) is a C++ / Python platform to perform parallel computations of
optimisation tasks (global and local) via the asynchronous generalized
island model.
dependent_to.name: pygmo

dependent_to.description:
The Pythia program is a standard tool for the generation of events in
high-energy collisions, comprising a coherent set of physics models for
the evolution from a few-body hard process to a complex multiparticle
final state.
dependent_to.name: pythia8

dependent_to.description:
QMCPACK, is a modern high-performance open-source Quantum Monte Carlo
(QMC) simulation code.
dependent_to.name: qmcpack

dependent_to.description: A complete tool set for molecular QTL discovery and analysis.
dependent_to.name: qtltools

dependent_to.description:
Computes informative enrichment and quality measures for ChIP-seq/DNase-
seq/FAIRE-seq/MNase-seq data. This is a modified version of r-spp to be
used in conjunction with the phantompeakqualtools package.
dependent_to.name: r-phantompeakqualtools

dependent_to.description: R package to read and write las and laz files used to store LiDAR data
dependent_to.name: r-rlas

dependent_to.description:
Range v3 forms the basis of a proposal to add range support to the
standard library (N4128: Ranges for the Standard Library). It also will
be the reference implementation for an upcoming Technical Specification.
These are the first steps toward turning ranges into an international
standard.
dependent_to.name: range-v3

dependent_to.description:
RDKit is a collection of cheminformatics and machine-learning software
written in C++ and Python.
dependent_to.name: rdkit

dependent_to.description:
RePrimAnd: Recovery of Primitives And EOS framework RePrimAnd is a
support library for numerical simulations of general relativistic
magnetohydrodynamics. It provides methods for recovering primitive
variables like pressure and velocity from the variables evolved in
quasi-conservative formulations. Further, it provides a general
framework for handling matter equations of state.
dependent_to.name: reprimand

dependent_to.description:
Bayesian phylogenetic inference using probabilistic graphical models and
an interpreted language.
dependent_to.name: revbayes

dependent_to.description:
RMGDFT is a high performance real-space density functional code designed
for large scale electronic structure calculations.
dependent_to.name: rmgdft

dependent_to.description: Radeon Open Compute FFT library
dependent_to.name: rocfft

dependent_to.description: Radeon Open Compute Tensile library
dependent_to.name: rocm-tensile

dependent_to.description:
A compiler infrastructure to build source-to-source program
transformation and analysis tools. (Developed at Lawrence Livermore
National Lab)
dependent_to.name: rose

dependent_to.description:
Radeon Performance Primitives (RPP) library is a comprehensive high-
performance computer vision library for AMD (CPU and GPU) with HIP and
OPENCL back-ends
dependent_to.name: rpp

dependent_to.description: RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for R.
dependent_to.name: rstudio

dependent_to.description: Sailfish is a tool for transcript quantification from RNA-seq data.
dependent_to.name: sailfish

dependent_to.description:
Salmon is a tool for quantifying the expression of transcripts using
RNA-seq data.
dependent_to.name: salmon

dependent_to.description:
salome-medcoupling is a part of SALOME platform to manipulate meshes and
fields in memory, and use salome-med format for files.
dependent_to.name: salome-medcoupling

dependent_to.description:
SAMRAI (Structured Adaptive Mesh Refinement Application Infrastructure)
is an object-oriented C++ software library enables exploration of
numerical, algorithmic, parallel computing, and software issues
associated with applying structured adaptive mesh refinement (SAMR)
technology in large-scale parallel application development.
dependent_to.name: samrai

dependent_to.description:
Intervals coupled with algebra of set to handle adaptive mesh refinement
and operators on it
dependent_to.name: samurai

dependent_to.description:
Sartre 1 is an event generator for exclusive diffractive vector meson
production and DVCS in ep and eA collisions based on the dipole model.
dependent_to.name: sartre

dependent_to.description: Sarus is an OCI-compliant container engine for HPC systems.
dependent_to.name: sarus

dependent_to.description: Scallop is a reference-based transcriptome assembler for RNA-seq
dependent_to.name: scallop

dependent_to.description:
Scan Tailor is an interactive post-processing tool for scanned pages. It
performs operations such as page splitting, deskewing, adding/removing
borders, and others. You give it raw scans, and you get pages ready to
be printed or assembled into a PDF or DJVU file. Scanning, optical
character recognition, and assembling multi-page documents are out of
scope of this project.
dependent_to.name: scantailor

dependent_to.description:
Core provides the functionality necessary to couple the individual SCINE
modules together
dependent_to.name: scine-core

dependent_to.description: Chemoinformatics toolkit with support for inorganic molecules.
dependent_to.name: scine-molassembler

dependent_to.description: Scine QCMaquis DMRG Solver
dependent_to.name: scine-qcmaquis

dependent_to.description:
ReaDuct allows you to carry out structure optimizations, transition
state searches and intrinsic reaction coordinate (IRC) calculations
among other things
dependent_to.name: scine-readuct

dependent_to.description: Wrapper around Serenity to make it compatible with Scine
dependent_to.name: scine-serenity

dependent_to.description:
Sparrow: fast semiempirical quantum chemical calculations. When
publishing results obtained with Sparrow, please cite the corresponding
release as archived on Zenodo (DOI 10.5281/zenodo.3244105; please use
the DOI of the respective release). In addition, we kindly request you
to cite the following article when using Sparrow: T. Husch, A. C.
Vaucher, M. Reiher, "Semiempirical molecular orbital models based on the
neglect of diatomic differential overlap approximation", Int. J. Quantum
Chem., 2018, 118, e25799.
dependent_to.name: scine-sparrow

dependent_to.description: Contains functionality which is used in most SCINE modules.
dependent_to.name: scine-utilities

dependent_to.description: Wrapper around xtb to export it into the Scine tool chain.
dependent_to.name: scine-xtb

dependent_to.description: scanf for modern C++
dependent_to.name: scnlib

dependent_to.description:
SeqAn is an open source C++ library of efficient algorithms and data
structures for the analysis of sequences with the focus on biological
data. Our library applies a unique generic design that guarantees high
performance, generality, extensibility, and integration with other
libraries. SeqAn is easy to use and simplifies the development of new
software tools with a minimal loss of performance
dependent_to.name: seqan

dependent_to.description: Subsystem focused quantum chemistry code Serenity
dependent_to.name: serenity

dependent_to.description:
Serenity fork of libint, which is difficult to reproduce from libint
itself
dependent_to.name: serenity-libint

dependent_to.description:
Serialbox is a serialization library and tools for C/C++, Python3 and
Fortran. Serialbox is used in several projects for building validation
frameworks against reference runs.
dependent_to.name: serialbox

dependent_to.description:
SFCGAL is a C++ wrapper library around CGAL with the aim of supporting
ISO 19107:2013 and OGC Simple Features Access 1.2 for 3D operations.
SFCGAL provides standard compliant geometry types and operations, that
can be accessed from its C or C++ APIs.
dependent_to.name: sfcgal

dependent_to.description:
SGpp is a library and framework for sparse grids in different flavors.
SGpp supports both hierarchical spatially-adaptive sparse grids and the
dimensionally-adaptive sparse grid combination technique.
dependent_to.name: sgpp

dependent_to.description:
SHAPEIT4 is a fast and accurate method for estimation of haplotypes (aka
phasing) for SNP array and high coverage sequencing data.
dependent_to.name: shapeit4

dependent_to.description:
ShapeMapper automates the calculation of RNA structure probing
reactivities from mutational profiling (MaP) experiments, in which
chemical adducts on RNA are detected as internal mutations in cDNA
through reverse transcription and read out by massively parallel
sequencing.
dependent_to.name: shapemapper

dependent_to.description:
Shark is a fast, modular, general open-source C++ machine learning
library.
dependent_to.name: shark

dependent_to.description:
SimGrid is a framework for developing simulators of distributed
applications targetting distributed platforms, which can in turn be used
to prototype, evaluate and compare relevant platform configurations,
system designs, and algorithmic approaches.
dependent_to.name: simgrid

dependent_to.description: Official repository of the SOCI - The C++ Database Access Library
dependent_to.name: soci

dependent_to.description:
This program, given a source file, produces a document with syntax
highlighting. It also provides a C++ highlight library (since version
3.0).
dependent_to.name: source-highlight

dependent_to.description:
Sparrow: fast semiempirical quantum chemical calculations. When
publishing results obtained with Sparrow, please cite the corresponding
release as archived on Zenodo (DOI 10.5281/zenodo.3244105; please use
the DOI of the respective release). In addition, we kindly request you
to cite the following article when using Sparrow: T. Husch, A. C.
Vaucher, M. Reiher, "Semiempirical molecular orbital models based on the
neglect of diatomic differential overlap approximation", Int. J. Quantum
Chem., 2018, 118, e25799.
dependent_to.name: sparrow

dependent_to.description:
The SpECTRE numerical relativity code. SpECTRE is an open-source code
for multi-scale, multi-physics problems in astrophysics and
gravitational physics. In the future, we hope that it can be applied to
problems across discipline boundaries in fluid dynamics, geoscience,
plasma physics, nuclear physics, and engineering. It runs at petascale
and is designed for future exascale computers. SpECTRE is being
developed in support of our collaborative Simulating eXtreme Spacetimes
(SXS) research program into the multi-messenger astrophysics of neutron
star mergers, core-collapse supernovae, and gamma-ray bursts.
dependent_to.name: spectre

dependent_to.description:
Spot is a C++11 library for omega-automata manipulation and model
checking.
dependent_to.name: spot

dependent_to.description:
srcML is an XML format for source code. The XML markup identifies
elements of the abstract syntax of the source-code language. The toolkit
includes parsing supports conversion of C, C++, C#, and Java both to and
from the srcML format. The format allows leveraging XML tools to support
the various tasks of source code exploration, analysis, and
manipulation.
dependent_to.name: srcml

dependent_to.description: Library to create, manipulate, and export graphs Graphlib.
dependent_to.name: stat

dependent_to.description: STochastic Engine for Pathway Simulation
dependent_to.name: steps

dependent_to.description: SymEngine is a fast symbolic manipulation library, written in C++.
dependent_to.name: symengine

dependent_to.description: SymPol is a C++ tool to work with symmetric polyhedra
dependent_to.name: sympol

dependent_to.description:
Tamaas is a C++ library with a Python interface that efficiently solves
contact mechanics problems with periodic rough surfaces, plasticity,
adhesion and friction.
dependent_to.name: tamaas

dependent_to.description:
The TecIO library allows third-party applications to read and write
Tecplot file format.
dependent_to.name: tecio

dependent_to.description: Supporting tools for the Templight Profiler
dependent_to.name: templight-tools

dependent_to.description:
The TFEL project is a collaborative development of CEA (French
Alternative Energies and Atomic Energy Commission) and EDF (Electricite
de France). It mostly contains the MFront code generator which
translates a set of closely related domain specific languages into plain
C++ on top of the TFEL libraries. MFront handles material properties,
mechanical behaviours and simple point-wise models. Interfaces are
provided for several finite element solvers, such as: Abaqus/Standard,
Abaqus/Explicit, Ansys APDL, Cast3M, Europlexus, Code_Aster, CalculiX
and a few others. MFront comes with an handy easy-to-use tool called
MTest that can test the local behaviour of a material, by imposing
independent constraints on each component of the strain or the stress.
dependent_to.name: tfel

dependent_to.description: Toolkit for High Energy Physics Event Generation
dependent_to.name: thepeg

dependent_to.description: Library to evaluate alloy compositions in Phase-Field models
dependent_to.name: thermo4pfm

dependent_to.description:
Software framework for scalable cross-language services development.
Thrift combines a software stack with a code generation engine to build
services that work efficiently and seamlessly between C++, Java, Python,
PHP, Ruby, Erlang, Perl, Haskell, C#, Cocoa, JavaScript, Node.js,
Smalltalk, OCaml and Delphi and other languages.
dependent_to.name: thrift

dependent_to.description: Spliced read mapper for RNA-Seq.
dependent_to.name: tophat

dependent_to.description:
The Trilinos Project is an effort to develop algorithms and enabling
technologies within an object-oriented software framework for the
solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and
scientific problems. A unique design feature of Trilinos is its focus on
packages.
dependent_to.name: trilinos

dependent_to.description:
An instrumentation framework for building dynamic analysis. There are
Valgrind tools that can automatically detect many memory management and
threading bugs, and profile your programs in detail. You can also use
Valgrind to build new tools. Valgrind is Open Source / Free Software,
and is freely available under the GNU General Public License, version 2.
dependent_to.name: valgrind

dependent_to.description:
Very-Low Overhead Checkpointing System. VELOC is a multi-level
checkpoint-restart runtime for HPC supercomputing infrastructures
dependent_to.name: veloc

dependent_to.description:
VIGRA stands for "Vision with Generic Algorithms". It's an image
processing and analysis library that puts its main emphasis on
customizable algorithms and data structures
dependent_to.name: vigra

dependent_to.description:
VOTCA is a software package which focuses on the analysis of molecular
dynamics data, the development of systematic coarse-graining techniques
as well as methods used for simulating microscopic charge (and exciton)
transport in disordered semiconductors.
dependent_to.name: votca

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA coarse-graining engine.
dependent_to.name: votca-csg

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA coarse-graining tutorials.
dependent_to.name: votca-csg-tutorials

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA coarse-graining extra apps.
dependent_to.name: votca-csgapps

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the basic tools library of VOTCA.
dependent_to.name: votca-tools

dependent_to.description:
The Visualization Toolkit (VTK) is an open-source, freely available
software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing and
visualization.
dependent_to.name: vtk

dependent_to.description:
WarpX is an advanced electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell code. It supports
many features including Perfectly-Matched Layers (PML) and mesh
refinement. In addition, WarpX is a highly-parallel and highly-optimized
code and features hybrid GPU/OpenMP/MPI parallelization and load
balancing capabilities.
dependent_to.name: warpx

dependent_to.description: Simulates whole cell models using discrete event simulation.
dependent_to.name: wcs

dependent_to.description:
Wonton is a support package for the Portage
(https://github.com/laristra/portage) and Tangram
(https://github.com/laristra/tangram) libraries. It contains some
mesh/state classes, wrappers for other mesh/state libraries and some
utilities required by Portage and Tangram.
dependent_to.name: wonton

dependent_to.description:
Wt, C++ Web Toolkit. Wt is a C++ library for developing web
applications.
dependent_to.name: wt

dependent_to.description:
"A very powerful performance visualization and analysis tool based on
traces that can be used to analyse any information that is expressed on
its input trace format. Traces for parallel MPI, OpenMP and other
programs can be genereated with Extrae.
dependent_to.name: wxparaver

dependent_to.description:
XDMF, or eXtensible Data Model and Format (XDMF), is a common data model
format to exchange scientific data between High Performance Computing
codes and tools.
dependent_to.name: xdmf3

dependent_to.description: XML-IO-SERVER library for IO management of climate models.
dependent_to.name: xios

dependent_to.description:
Xolotl is a high-performance computing code using advection-reaction-
diffusion (ADR) kinetic rate theory to model the time evolution of the
divertor material in next generation tokamaks, like ITER, as well as
nuclear fuel in fission reactors.
dependent_to.name: xolotl

dependent_to.description: Yade is an free software for particle based simulations.
dependent_to.name: yade

dependent_to.description: A YAML parser and emitter in C++
dependent_to.name: yaml-cpp

dependent_to.description: YODA - Yet more Objects for Data Analysis
dependent_to.name: yoda

description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.
name: boost

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: Compile with clang libc++ instead of libstdc++
variants.name: clanglibcpp

variants.description: Use the specified backend for boost-context
variants.name: context-impl

variants.description: Use the specified C++ standard when building.
variants.name: cxxstd

variants.description: Switch to the debug version of Boost
variants.name: debug

variants.description: Build with Unicode and ICU suport
variants.name: icu

variants.description: Generate position-independent code (PIC), useful for building static libraries
variants.name: pic

variants.description: Augment library names with build options
variants.name: taggedlayout

variants.description: Augment library layout with versioned subdirs
variants.name: versionedlayout

variants.description: Default symbol visibility in compiled libraries (1.69.0 or later)
variants.name: visibility
